results.title: Simvastatin and non-segmental vitiligo: A new potential treatment option?
results.text_hl: We sought in this study to evaluate the influence of @<m>CHEMICAL_Simvastatin</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D019821 @@@simvastatin@@@ on @<m>DISEASE_Mouth_Diseases</m> @DISEASE_MESH:D009059 @@@vitiliginous lesions@@@ in @DISEASE_Vitiligo @DISEASE_MESH:D014820 @@@NSV@@@ @SPECIES_9606 @@@patients@@@ with @DISEASE_Dyslipidemias @DISEASE_MESH:D050171 @@@dyslipidemia@@@ and study the correlation between VIDA score and @CHEMICAL_Lipids @CHEMICAL_MESH:D008055 @@@lipid@@@ profile.

citations.NLM: Shaker ESE, Allam SH, Mabrouk MM, Elgharbawy NM, Salaam SFA. Simvastatin and non-segmental vitiligo: A new potential treatment option? Dermatol Ther. 2022 Dec;35(12):e15969. PMID: 36346030

results.title: Effect of simvastatin on baboon endometriosis.
results.text_hl: The volume of red, orange-red, and white @<m>DISEASE_Mouth_Diseases</m> @DISEASE_MESH:D009059 @@@endometriotic lesions@@@ was significantly reduced by 78% in animals treated with @<m>CHEMICAL_Simvastatin</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D019821 @@@simvastatin@@@.

citations.NLM: Taylor HS, Alderman Iii M, D'Hooghe TM, Fazleabas AT, Duleba AJ. Effect of simvastatin on baboon endometriosis. Biol Reprod. 2017 Jul 1;97(1):32-38. PMID: 28637327
citations.BibTeX: @article{28637327, title={Effect of simvastatin on baboon endometriosis.}, author={Taylor HS and Alderman Iii M and D'Hooghe TM and Fazleabas AT and Duleba AJ}, journal={Biol Reprod}, volume={97}, number={1}, pages={32-38}}

results.title: Effects of simvastatin on neuroprotection and modulation of Bcl-2 and BAX in the rat quinolinic acid model of Huntington's disease.
results.text_hl: Two more groups of animals received a pretreatment with 1mg/kg @<m>CHEMICAL_Simvastatin</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D019821 @@@simvastatin@@@ i.p. for 2 weeks before the @<m>DISEASE_Mouth_Diseases</m> @DISEASE_MESH:D009059 @@@QA lesion@@@ and then were treated with @<m>CHEMICAL_Simvastatin</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D019821 @@@simvastatin@@@ for the following 2 weeks or 8 weeks, respectively.

citations.NLM: Patassini S, Giampà C, Martorana A, Bernardi G, Fusco FR. Effects of simvastatin on neuroprotection and modulation of Bcl-2 and BAX in the rat quinolinic acid model of Huntington's disease. Neurosci Lett. 2008 Dec 19;448(1):166-9. PMID: 18938217
citations.BibTeX: @article{18938217, title={Effects of simvastatin on neuroprotection and modulation of Bcl-2 and BAX in the rat quinolinic acid model of Huntington's disease.}, author={Patassini S and Giampà C and Martorana A and Bernardi G and Fusco FR}, journal={Neurosci Lett}, volume={448}, number={1}, pages={166-9}}

results.title: CHILD syndrome mimicking verrucous nevus in a Chinese patient responded well to the topical therapy of compound of simvastatin and cholesterol.
results.text_hl: The topical application of a mixed lotion containing 2% @<m>CHEMICAL_Simvastatin</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D019821 @@@simvastatin@@@ and 2% @CHEMICAL_Cholesterol @CHEMICAL_MESH:D002784 @@@cholesterol@@@ to @<m>DISEASE_Mouth_Diseases</m> @DISEASE_MESH:D009059 @@@lesion@@@ areas based on the pathogenesis as well as the literature review.

citations.NLM: Yu X, Zhang J, Gu Y, Deng D, Wu Z, Bao L, Li M, Yao Z. CHILD syndrome mimicking verrucous nevus in a Chinese patient responded well to the topical therapy of compound of simvastatin and cholesterol. J Eur Acad Dermatol Venereol. 2018 Jul;32(7):1209-1213. PMID: 29341259
citations.BibTeX: @article{29341259, title={CHILD syndrome mimicking verrucous nevus in a Chinese patient responded well to the topical therapy of compound of simvastatin and cholesterol.}, author={Yu X and Zhang J and Gu Y and Deng D and Wu Z and Bao L and Li M and Yao Z}, journal={J Eur Acad Dermatol Venereol}, volume={32}, number={7}, pages={1209-1213}}

results.title: Resveratrol potentiates effect of simvastatin on inhibition of mevalonate pathway in human endometrial stromal cells.
results.text_hl: CONTEXT: Growth of @<m>DISEASE_Mouth_Diseases</m> @DISEASE_MESH:D009059 @@@endometriotic lesions@@@ in rodent model of @DISEASE_Endometriosis @DISEASE_MESH:D004715 @@@endometriosis@@@ is inhibited by @CHEMICAL_Resveratrol @CHEMICAL_MESH:D000077185 @@@resveratrol@@@, a natural @CHEMICAL_Polyphenols @CHEMICAL_MESH:D059808 @@@polyphenol@@@ with antiproliferative and antiinflammatory properties, and @<m>CHEMICAL_Simvastatin</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D019821 @@@simvastatin@@@, an inhibitor of @GENE_HMGCR @GENE_3156 @@@3-hydroxy-3-methylglutaryl-coenzyme A reductase@@@ (@GENE_HMGCR @GENE_3156 @@@HMGCR@@@) activity.

citations.NLM: Villanueva JA, Sokalska A, Cress AB, Ortega I, Bruner-Tran KL, Osteen KG, Duleba AJ. Resveratrol potentiates effect of simvastatin on inhibition of mevalonate pathway in human endometrial stromal cells. J Clin Endocrinol Metab. 2013 Mar;98(3):E455-62. PMID: 23386644
citations.BibTeX: @article{23386644, title={Resveratrol potentiates effect of simvastatin on inhibition of mevalonate pathway in human endometrial stromal cells.}, author={Villanueva JA and Sokalska A and Cress AB and Ortega I and Bruner-Tran KL and Osteen KG and Duleba AJ}, journal={J Clin Endocrinol Metab}, volume={98}, number={3}, pages={E455-62}}

results.title: Simvastatin reduces reperfusion injury by modulating nitric oxide synthase expression: an ex vivo study in isolated working rat hearts.
results.text_hl: We evaluated creatinephosphokinase and @CHEMICAL_Nitrites @CHEMICAL_MESH:D009573 @@@nitrite@@@ levels in coronary effluent, heart weight changes, microvascular permeability (extravasation of @CHEMICAL_Fluorescein @CHEMICAL_MESH:D019793 @@@fluoresceine@@@-labeled albumin), ultrastructural alterations, and the expression of endothelial (e) and inducible (i) nitric oxide synthase (NOS) (by reverse-transcribed polymerase chain reaction and Western blotting) in the presence or absence of the transcriptional inhibitor @CHEMICAL_Dactinomycin @CHEMICAL_MESH:D003609 @@@actinomycin-D.@@@ RESULTS: @<m>CHEMICAL_Simvastatin</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D019821 @@@Simvastatin@@@ (25 microM) significantly reduced @DISEASE_Cardiomyopathies @DISEASE_MESH:D009202 @@@myocardial damage@@@ and vascular hyperpermeability, concomitant with a reduction in endothelial and @<m>DISEASE_Mouth_Diseases</m> @DISEASE_MESH:D009059 @@@cardiomyocyte lesions@@@.

citations.NLM: Di Napoli P, Antonio Taccardi A, Grilli A, Spina R, Felaco M, Barsotti A, De Caterina R. Simvastatin reduces reperfusion injury by modulating nitric oxide synthase expression: an ex vivo study in isolated working rat hearts. Cardiovasc Res. 2001 Aug 1;51(2):283-93. PMID: 11470468
citations.BibTeX: @article{11470468, title={Simvastatin reduces reperfusion injury by modulating nitric oxide synthase expression: an ex vivo study in isolated working rat hearts.}, author={Di Napoli P and Antonio Taccardi A and Grilli A and Spina R and Felaco M and Barsotti A and De Caterina R}, journal={Cardiovasc Res}, volume={51}, number={2}, pages={283-93}}

results.title: Statin-related Lichenoid Dermatosis: An Uncommon Adverse Reaction to a Common Treatment
results.journal: Eur J Case Rep Intern Med
results.text_hl: We present the case of a 65-year-old @SPECIES_9606 @@@woman@@@ with severe @DISEASE_Hypercholesterolemia @DISEASE_MESH:D006937 @@@hypercholesterolemia@@@, who developed generalized @<m>DISEASE_Mouth_Diseases</m> @DISEASE_MESH:D009059 @@@erythematous cutaneous lesions@@@ with @DISEASE_Pruritus @DISEASE_MESH:D011537 @@@pruritus@@@, resembling @DISEASE_Lichen_Planus @DISEASE_MESH:D008010 @@@lichen planus@@@, months after starting treatment with @<m>CHEMICAL_Simvastatin</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D019821 @@@simvastatin@@@.

citations.NLM: Vesza Z, Pires C, da Silva PM. Statin-related Lichenoid Dermatosis: An Uncommon Adverse Reaction to a Common Treatment Eur J Case Rep Intern Med. 2018;5(5):000844. PMID: 30756034
citations.BibTeX: @article{30756034, title={Statin-related Lichenoid Dermatosis: An Uncommon Adverse Reaction to a Common Treatment}, author={Vesza Z and Pires C and da Silva PM}, journal={Eur J Case Rep Intern Med}, volume={5}, number={5}, pages={000844}}

results.title: The Evaluation of Vitiligous lesions Repigmentation after the Administration of Atorvastatin calcium salt and Simvastatin-acid sodium salt in patients with active vitiligo (EVRAAS), a pilot study: study protocol for a randomized controlled trial
results.text_hl: The aim of this study is to evaluate the influence of @<m>CHEMICAL_Simvastatin</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D019821 @@@simvastatin@@@ and @CHEMICAL_Atorvastatin @CHEMICAL_MESH:D000069059 @@@atorvastatin@@@ on @<m>DISEASE_Mouth_Diseases</m> @DISEASE_MESH:D009059 @@@vitiligous lesions@@@ in @SPECIES_9606 @@@patients@@@ with nonsegmental @DISEASE_Vitiligo @DISEASE_MESH:D014820 @@@vitiligo@@@ (@DISEASE_Vitiligo @DISEASE_MESH:D014820 @@@NSV@@@).

citations.NLM: Niezgoda A, Winnicki A, Kosmalski T, Kowaliszyn B, Krysiński J, Czajkowski R. The Evaluation of Vitiligous lesions Repigmentation after the Administration of Atorvastatin calcium salt and Simvastatin-acid sodium salt in patients with active vitiligo (EVRAAS), a pilot study: study protocol for a randomized controlled trial Trials. 2019 Jan 25;20(1):78. PMID: 30683146
